webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Summer Streets on Darlinghurst Road and Macleay Street

properties.headline: Summer Streets event - KINGS CROSS Darlinghurst Road and Macleay Street between Bayswater Road, Darlinghurst AND Hughes Street, Potts Point
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Summer Streets - Kings Cross road closure and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Summer Streets - Kings Cross road closure and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Summer Streets event along Darlinghurst Rd and Macleay St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

The following roads will be closed from 9am until 11:30pm: 

  • Darlinghurst Rd between Bayswater Rd and Macleay St
  • Macleay St between Darlinghurst Rd and Hughes St
  • Orwell St between Orwell Ln and Macleay St 

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Darlinghurst Rd, Macleay St, Orwell St, Ward Ave and Elizabeth Bay Rd. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURE

KINGS CROSS

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Darlinghurst Rd between Bayswater Rd and Macleay St
  • Macleay St between Darlinghurst Rd and Hughes St
  • Orwell St between Orwell Ln and Macleay St

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the road unless specified otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

KINGS CROSS

FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Darlinghurst Rd between Bayswater Rd and Macleay St
  • Elizabeth Bay Rd between Ward Ave and Elizabeth Bay Rd (Eastern side)
  • Elizabeth Bay Rd between Baroda St and Birtley Pl (Western side)
  • Macleay St between Darlinghurst Rd and Greenknowe Ave
  • Orwell St between Orwell Ln and Macleay St (Northern side)
  • Ward Ave between Kellett St and Roslyn St (Western side)
  • Ward Ave between Barncleuth Sq and Elizabeth Bay Rd (Eastern side)
  • Ward Ave between Barncleuth Sq and Baroda St (Western side)

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Summer Streets event along Redfern St. The event runs from 11am until 9pm.

The following roads will be closed from 9am until 10:30pm:  

  • George St between Turner St and Wells St
  • George St between Phillip St and Turner St (Northbound)
  • Glover Ln between Turner St and Redfern St
  • Redfern St between Regent St and Chalmers St
  • Renwick St between Turner St and Wells St

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 10:30pm on sections of George St and Redfern St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

REDFERN FROM 9AM TO 10:30PM

  • George St between Turner St and Wells St
  • George St* between Phillip St and Turner St (Northbound)
  • Glover Ln* between Turner St and Redfern St
  • Redfern St between Regent St and Chalmers St
  • Renwick St* between Turner St and Wells St

Notes: * Resident access only

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

REDFERN

FROM 8AM UNTIL 10:30PM

  • George St between Turner St and Wells St
  • Redfern St between Regent St and Chalmers St

properties.headline: Big Bash League - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park transport and walking map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: SCO_1080_MOORE PARK WALK_17DEC21_V017 NO SHUTTLES OR EP2.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park transport and walking map

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL: Sydney Sixers v Sydney Thunder at the SCG. Play starts from 6.40pm, finish at around 9.35pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3.40pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Access EP2 car park via Moore Park Rd and access EP3 grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car parks via Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 3pm to midnight on sections of Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO MIDNIGHT

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header: Sydney FC v Brisbane Roar at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Women's Kick off from 7.05pm, Men's Kick off from 7.45pm and full-time 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race from 12:20pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: Motocross Event - COFFS HARBOUR Pacific Highway between Marcia Street AND Beryl Street
properties.otherAdvice:
Stadium MX Motocross is taking place from Friday 14 to Saturday 15 January at Coffs Harbour Showground from 9am to 10pm each day. 

During the event, the northbound right-turn lane on Pacific Hwy into Coffs Harbour Showground will be closed. Motorists will only be able to access the Showground southbound via the Pacific Hwy.

Motorists should take care while travelling in the area and allow extra travel time.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the game.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd.

properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Tennis Classic at Ken Rosewall Arena from Monday 10 - Saturday 15 January. Day sessions start from 11am daily. Night sessions start from from 7pm daily.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd as fans travel to the event.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the arena.

Pre-book parking at Sydney Olympic Park online to secure a space, available by 11.59pm the night before.

webLinks.linkText: Australia Day - TfNSW Interactive road closure map
Australia Day 2022  - What's On in Sydney

properties.headline: Australia Day in Sydney - CIRCULAR QUAY George Street, Hickson Road
properties.publicTransport: Ferries will be affected during the day and in the evening due to exclusion zones on the harbour. Circular Quay buses will relocate to Martin Place in the evening due to road closures. Visit transportnsw.info for details.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Australia Day 2022 - Sydney CBD Road closures & clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Australia Day 2022 - Sydney CBD Road closures & clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks will close during the day and evening for Australia Day events in the city and around the harbour.

Key road closure timings:

  • 4am to midnight: George St from Essex St to Lower Fort St. Sections of Argyle St, Circular Quay West, Essex St and Pitt St.
  • 7am to 10am: Hickson Rd from Napoleon St to Pottinger St, Towns Pl from Dalgety Rd to Hickson Rd, and Barton St (for Oz Day 10K wheelchair race).
  • 7am to midnight: Hickson Rd from George St to Pottinger St and OPT Elevated Rd from Hickson Rd.
  • 7.30pm to 10.30pm: Cahill Expressway lanes 7 & 8 and Overpass at Circular Quay including the High St, Mount St and Domain Tunnel on-ramps and lane 4 on the Harbour Bridge. Roads in Circular Quay including sections of Albert St, Alfred St, Circular Quay East, Essex St, George St, Loftus St, Phillip St and Young St.

The speed limit on the Harbour Bridge will be reduced to 40km/h from 8pm to 9.30pm.

The Cahill Expressway overpass walkway will be closed from 5pm to 9:30pm. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will remain open.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks from 3am until midnight with additional clearways in place throughout the city on various roads between Circular Quay and Martin Place from 5pm until 10.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits and Mobility Scheme permit holders. Check signs carefully on the day and the night before, as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

arrangementElements.html:
Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopen after infrastructure has been removed and cleansing has finished.  

CIRCULAR QUAY / THE ROCKS

FROM 4:00AM TO 12AM MIDNIGHT

  • Circular Quay West from Argyle Street
  • Essex Street between Harrington Street and George Street (Eastbound)
  • George Street between Essex Street and Lower Fort Street
  • Mill Lane between George Street and Kendall Lane
  • Pitt Street between Alfred Street and Reiby Place

  • Hickson Road between Napoleon Street and Pottinger Street
  • Towns Place between Dalgety Road and Hickson Road  

THE ROCKS

FROM 7:00AM TO MIDNIGHT

  • OPT Elevated Road from Hickson Road

FROM 7:30PM TO 10:30PM

  • Cahill Expressway Sydney Harbour Bridge Lane 7 and Lane 8

  • Cahill Expressway from High Street On-Ramp  
  • Cahill Expressway Mount Street On-Ramp to Cahill Expressway  
  • Domain Tunnel Off-Ramp to the Cahill Expressway

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend Lunar New Year celebrations along Forest Rd in Hurstville from 4pm to 10pm.

The following roads will be closed from 10am until midnight: 

  • Forest Rd between Queens Rd and Macmahon St (eastbound lanes)
  • Forest Rd between Macmahon St and Woodville St
  • Macmahon St between Forest Rd and Dora St

Special event clearways will also be in place on these roads from 10am until midnight. 

Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual on roads in the area including King Georges Rd, Queens Rd and Railway Pde during the event.

webLinks.linkText: Sun Run 2022 - TfNSW interactive road closure & clearway map

properties.headline: Sun Run 7km and 10km events - DEE WHY, CURL CURL, FRESHWATER, QUEENSCLIFF, MANLY The Strand, Griffin Road, North Steyne & South Steyne
properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert while roads are closed along the course. Visit transportnsw.info for more info and to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sun Run 2022 - Road closures, changed access and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sun Run 2022 - Road closures, changed access and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
The annual Sun Run 7km and 10km fun run events will start at 6:15am from The Strand in Dee Why and finish by 9:30am at South Steyne in Manly. Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect. All roads will re-open by 11am. 

Residents along the course are urged to plan ahead and relocate their vehicles outside the road closure footprint if vehicle access is required on event day. There will be limited vehicle movements permitted while the event is underway. 

Road closures:

  • Dee Why - 3.30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde. Crossover maintained on Oaks Ave at The Strand eastbound until 5:15am and westbound until 6am. 
  • Curl Curl to Freshwater - 5:30am to 9am: Griffin Rd, Pitt Rd, Abbott Rd, Carrington Pde and local surrounding roads will be closed. Crossover maintained on Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde in both directions and on Playfair Rd, Ross Rd at Pitt Rd until 6am. 
  • Queenscliff - 5.30am to 10am: sections of Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd, Dowling St, Lumsdaine Dr and surrounding local roads. Crossover maintained westbound (exit only) on Crowd Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am-6:15am and 9am-10am. 
  • Manly - 3.30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads. Managed access for Cameron Ave residents from 5.30am-9am.
  • Manly - 3.30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3:30am until 9am along sections of roads in Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly including sections of Abbott Road, Howard Avenue, The Strand, Evans Street, Crown Road and North Steyne.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

  • Howard Ave between 94 Howard Ave and The Strand northern side
  • Howard Ave between The Strand and 103 Howard Ave southern side

  • North Steyne between The Corso and Raglan St western side
  • South Steyne between The Corso and Ashburner St eastern side
  • South Steyne between Victoria Pde and The Corso western side

From 5:15am to 9am

Notes: 1 Local access only until 6am. The Strand at Oaks Ave Eastbound crossover until 5:15am. Westbound crossover until 6am

From 5:30am to 9am

  • Boronia St between Monash Pde and Griffin Rd (westbound)
  • Griffin Rd between Pacific Pde and Headland Rd  
  • Monash Pde between Pacific Pde and Oaks Ave (northbound)
  • The Strand Between Pacific Pde and Griffin Rd  
  • The Strand Ln between Monash Pde and Griffin Rd    

Note. No vehicular access to roads between the course and the coast between 6am and 7:15am. Dee Why - Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde crossover in both directions until 6am

  • Pacific Pde1 between Wheeler Pde and Griffin Rd (eastbound)
  • Pacific Pde1 between Monash Pde and Griffin Rd (westbound)  

Note: 1 Dee Why - Griffin Rd at Pacific Pde crossover in both directions until 6am

NORTH CURL CURL

From 5:30am to 9am

roads.suburb: Dee Why, Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff, Manly

properties.headline: Police Operation - SURRY HILLS TO SYDNEY CBD Elizabeth Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Light rail services will also be impacted between Central and Moore Park. Check service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest updates.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads will be closed between Hyde Park in the Sydney CBD and Prince Alfred Park in Surry Hills between 11.45am and 3pm approximately for a planned Police Operation. Roads will progressively reopen when safe to do so. 

From 11.45am to 1.30pm approx:

  • Elizabeth St northbound from Randle St to King St, and southbound from Market St to Randle St
  • Park St westbound at Hyde Park from College St to Elizabeth St
  • Chalmers St between Cleveland St and Devonshire St
  • Roads adjoining Elizabeth and Chalmers Streets will also be closed including sections of Bathurst St, Eddy Ave, Wentworth Ave, Liverpool St, Hay St, Foveaux St, Goulburn St and other surrounding local roads.

From 12pm to 3pm approx:

  • Sections of King St, Phillip St and Elizabeth St around Hyde Park North/St James
  • Macquarie St between Hunter St and St James Rd
  • Prince Albert Rd/St James Rd at Hyde Park

Motorists should avoid travelling through the Sydney CBD and Surry Hills during this time or expect significant delays while roads are closed. Follow the directions of NSW Police on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Lunar Festival

properties.headline: Sydney Lunar Festival - HAYMARKET Harbour Street, Hay Street, Sussex Street at Chinatown
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Sydney Lunar Festival 2022 - road closures & clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Sydney Lunar Festival 2022 - road closures & clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Sydney Lunar Festival launch in Chinatown from 5pm until 10pm. 

Road closures will be in place from 12pm Saturday until 1am Sunday on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St, Little Pier St, Kimber Lane, Sussex St and Factory St. 

Special event clearways will be in effect from 10am Saturday until 1am Sunday on sections of Harbour St, Hay St, Little Hay St and Sussex St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, even for local residents or Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the direction of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

HAYMARKET

FROM 12PM MIDDAY SATURDAY, 29 JANUARY 2022 TO 1:00AM SUNDAY, 30 JANUARY 2022

ROAD CLOSURES WITH MANAGED ACCESS

  • Harbour Street between Goulburn Street and Little Hay St
  • Little Pier Street between Tumbalong Boulevard and Harbour Street
  • Sussex Street between Goulburn Street and 410 Sussex Street

FROM 12PM MIDDAY SATURDAY, 29 JANUARY 2022 TO 1:00AM SUNDAY, 30 JANUARY 2022

  • Factory Street between Harbour Street and Dixon Street
  • Harbour Street between Hay Street and Little Hay Street
  • Hay Street between George Street and Harbour Street
  • Little Hay Street between Sussex Street and Harbour Street
  • Kimber Lane between Factory Street and Hay Street
  • Sussex Street between 410 Sussex Street & Hay Street

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call the Traffic Information Line on 132 701 to find its new location.

HAYMARKET 

FROM 10AM SATURDAY 29 JANUARY UNTIL 1AM SUNDAY 30 JANUARY

  • Harbour Street between Hay Street and Goulburn Street
  • Hay Street between George Street and Harbour Street 
  • Little Hay Street between Sussex Street and Harbour Street 
  • Sussex Street between Goulburn Street and Hay Street
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures & Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street, Hay Street, Sussex Street

webLinks.linkText: Georges River Council - Summer Streets Markets

properties.headline: Local Markets - KOGARAH Belgrave Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Summer Streets - Kogarah Night Markets will be taking place on Friday 21 January from 4pm to 10pm. 

To accommodate the markets Belgrave St will be closed between Post Office Lane and Kensington Street from 10am until midnight. The Belgrave St parking bays will also be closed to the public from 5pm Thursday 20 January until midnight Friday 21 January. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: Soccer Match - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
FFA Cup Semi Final: Sydney FC V Central Coast Mariners from 7pm at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

properties.headline: Race Day - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race from 12:20pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: Comedy Show - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road approaching Qudos Bank Arena
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sooshi Mango: Off The Boat show at Qudos Bank Arena from 7.30pm until around 9.40pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd and Epping Rd.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.headline: Concert series - MOSMAN Bradleys Head Road approaching Taronga Zoo
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
A series of concerts will be held at Taronga Zoo between Friday 28 January and Saturday 19 February as part of the Twilight at Taronga 2022 Summer Concert Series. Shows start at 6pm and finish around 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual along Military Rd and Bradleys Head Rd approaching the Zoo as fans arrive, particularly during the evening peak for the weeknight shows.

Motorists should allow extra travel time.
